Twitter        Facebook     Windows Live     Yahoo                 MySpace     Email                   Bread Crumbs                Home          >           Academics          >           Courses          >           Course Detail                                        First-Year Research Seminar: Buddha Studio: The Art of Practice and the Practice of Art                                Semester and Year        SP 2013                    Course Number        FIRST-UG744                    Section        001                    Instructor        Jean Gallagher                    Days                            Tue,Thu                                 Time                            9:30 AM -       10:45 AM                                Units        4.0                    Level        U                    Foundation Requirement                                         Notes/Restrictions       Open to Gallatin first-year students only.                    Description       This course focuses on some of the ways in which American literature, visual arts, and music reflect, embody, or respond to Buddhist principles and practice. The course includes discussion of Buddhist thought and history, particularly its emergence in the North American context, and of traditional Buddhist arts. Work by Han Shan, Meng Hao-Jan, Meng Chiao, Matsuo Basho, Henry David Thoreau, Ralph Waldo Emerson, John Cage, Meredith Monk, Laurie Anderson, Bill Viola, Marina Abramovic, Gary Snyder, Li Young Li, Arther Sze, Lan Cao, Maxine Hong Kingston, Joanne Kyger, Philip Whalen, and Jane Hirschfield may be included, along with critical and historical work by Donald Lopez, Richard Seager, Rick Fields, Charles Prebish, John Whalen-Bridge, Jonathan Stalling, Jacquelynn Baas, Kay Larson, and Mary Jane Jacobs. Writing in the course includes informal response papers, three to five shorter essays, and a longer research essay, produced in multiple drafts with in-class workshops.                 Syllabus       FIRST-UG744            Course Type       First-Year Program: Research Seminars (FIRST-UG)                               top of page                                                                   NYU Gallatin Footer              Gallatin School of Individualized Study     1 Washington Place     New York, NY 10003     (212) 998-7370                   A–Z Index      Directions      Contact Us      Job Opportunities               News      Support Gallatin      Feedback                         Follow us on Facebook      Follow us on Twitter      Follow us on Youtube         Follow us Instagram                 Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright NYU Gallatin. Technorati     Twitter        Facebook     Windows Live     Yahoo                 MySpace     Email                    Bread Crumbs                Home          >           Academics          >           Faculty          >           Jean Gallagher                               Jean Gallagher                                                           Professor of English, NYU Poly      B.A. English, Queens College, CUNY, 1985 Ph.D. English, CUNY Graduate Center, 1994           Jean Gallagher is a Professor of English at Polytechnic Institute of NYU. She is the author of three collections of poetry (  This Minute  , which received the Poets Out Loud Prize from Fordham University Press),  Stubborn  (winner of the FIELD Prize from Oberlin College Press), and  Start  , just out from Oberlin College Press. She also is the author of  The World Wars through the Female Gaze  (Southern Illinois UP), and has published critical essays on gender, modernist literature, and visual culture.                                     top of page                                     Contact Information     Jean Gallagher             Professor of English, NYU Poly              jgallagh@poly.edu             See Profes, Room Email                           Office Hours         Monday Leave             Tuesday Leave             Wednesday Leave             Thursday Leave               Friday Leave                                                Courses                                                   2014             Fall                            Transfer Student Research Seminar: Buddhism and Culture in the U.S.                  Mon,Wed      9:30 AM -      10:45 AM                                                   2013             Spring                            First-Year Research Seminar: Buddha Studio: The Art of Practice and the Practice of Art                  Tue,Thu      9:30 AM -      10:45 AM                                                   2013             Fall                            First-Year Writing Seminar: Contemplation and Culture                  Mon,Wed      12:30 PM -      1:45 PM                                                   2012             Fall                            First-Year Writing Seminar: Contemplation and Culture                  Tue,Thu      11:00 AM -      12:15 PM                                       Research and Teaching Interests       poetry and poetics; modernist literature and culture; feminist theory and gender studies; visual culture; nineteenth- and twentieth-century American literature                                                                                                              NYU Gallatin Footer              Gallatin School of Individualized Study     1 Washington Place     New York, NY 10003     (212) 998-7370                   A–Z Index      Directions      Contact Us      Job Opportunities               News      Support Gallatin      Feedback                         Follow us on Facebook      Follow us on Twitter      Follow us on Youtube         Follow us Instagram                 Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright NYU Gallatin.
